SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Vertebral artery (VA) transection is a rarely described entity that may present dramatically with a life-threatening external hemorrhage
CASE DESCRIPTION: A 25-year-old man that was victim of a terrorist attack presented a gunshot wound to the mouth with massive bleeding
The bullet perforated the oropharynx and injured the right VA
Combined antegrade and retrograde endovascular embolization by means of detachable coils allowed rapid control of the bleeding
CONCLUSION: Bleeding related to VA transection can be managed safely by means of endovascular combined approaches
